import React from 'react'; import './about.css'; function About() { return ( <>

Naidene Myers

A web development student living through my late father.

Throughout my life, I've faced the heart-wrenching experience of losing people I deeply care about. I attended more funerals during my younger years than I ever could have imagined. During those challenging times, I was fortunate to have a close-knit group of friends who were navigating the same turbulent waters of grief. We leaned on each other, providing a source of solace and understanding that was indispensable.

However, in 2020, I faced a personal turning point when I lost my beloved father to a short, intense battle with cancer. This time, I found myself grappling with my emotions in solitude. I tried to bury the pain by immersing myself in work, taking on two jobs, and filling my life with distractions. Yet, the void remained.

I also recognized the perils of social media, where reaching out for support can sometimes feel like swimming in shark-infested waters. It became evident that many individuals who needed comfort and understanding during their moments of grief were met with insensitivity and negativity in online spaces.

In response to these challenges, I embarked on a mission to create Eternally Bonded—a place born out of empathy and understanding. Eternally Bonded is more than just a blog; it's a sanctuary. Here, you have the freedom to use it as you see fit. Share your cherished photos, pour your heart into poems, or simply let your emotions flow freely. It's your personal outlet, a digital haven where you can navigate the complex waves of grief at your own pace.

But Eternally Bonded is not just about self-expression; it's about connection. It's about recognizing that you're not alone in your journey. Here, you can find solace in the stories of others who have experienced similar waves of grief. It's a place to connect, to feel loved, and to be genuinely appreciated for who you are.

In a world that can often feel cold and distant, Eternally Bonded offers warmth, understanding, and the embrace of a caring community. Whether you're seeking comfort, looking to connect, or simply in need of a safe space, everything you need is right here.

Welcome to Eternally Bonded, where your journey through grief is met with compassion, where your memories are celebrated, and where you are always supported on the path to healing.

With love and understanding,
Naidene Myers

In loving memory of my dear friends and cherished family members, including Diane Williams, Robert Brown, Margaret Everson, Rebecca Townshend, Jamie Walker, Katie Burt, Jake Krueger, and countless others. These remarkable souls crossed my path, and I was fortunate to call them family and beloved friends. Though they left us much too soon, their presence lives on in our hearts, and they will never be forgotten.

); } export default About;
